lexUnit.name: sort.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: select from a miscellaneous group

sentence.text: Jane Griffin sorts the good from the bad
Mary sees her task as sorting the wheat from the chaff -- the genuine cases from the cruel and careless .
The children began to sort large rectangular bricks into one pile .
He was sorting the feathers into smaller piles .
Corpse collectors were sorting fresh human meat for recycling .
Then I sort the internal mail for the office .
Her grandmother , as usual , was sorting the washing in the scullery .
On 24 April a team of about 10 began to sort the books by then accumulating in the Davidson Room .
Sort this list of pairs , in increasing order of the distance between the points .
The pupil can name , draw or sort 2-D shapes .
The referrals are usually sorted by a team leader , put in order of priority , and allocated to social workers .
The data can also be sorted by university , and journal , to show differences in publication patterns .
Photographs and diagrams have to be obtained or taken , labelled , sorted , chosen and captioned .
Additions should be sorted into descending order .
When sorting the stimulus cards into order , it was ensured that subjects could not see the cards .
By using the printer , the librarian could produce one or more copies of the booklist , sorted by author or perhaps title .
Then she flopped on the sofa to sort through the letters .
Connon continued to sort through the objects before him .
